during September and October 2009 in an
effort to stem the rising tide of
violence caused by Mexican drug cartels
the Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms
and Explosives ATF Phoenix office begins
its controversial Operation Fast and
Furious on October the 26th 2009
Department of Justice officials meet to
discuss the problem of mounting violence
in Mexico they decide it's time to
change strategy on how to deal with the
cartels and to eliminate and gun
trafficking pipelines there is no
mention of a gun walking during this
meeting in November 2009 the operation
is launched it is designed and around by
ATF Phoenix field office
fast and furious was supposedly a sting
operation aimed at arresting cartel
members President Obama and Attorney
General Eric Holder however had another
goal in mind justifying war in troponin
by controlling the regulations the idea
was to encourage the gun dealers to sell
to suspected traffickers affirm Mexican
drug cartels and see where the guns end
up the goal was to try to take down a
major cartel that the so called
gun-walking becomes increasingly
controversial among ATF agents ordered
to take part in a gun walking operation
guns bought by straw purchasers
individuals in America with clean
records where drug cartels are allowed
to walk across the border into Mexico
instead of being seized by ATF agents
the stated aim was for ATF agents to
follow the paths of guns from straw
purchasers through middlemen and into
the hierarchy of the powerful Sinaloa
drug cartel the tracked weapons were to
be used as evidence to pen larger crimes
against the cartel as they work to break
it up or at least eliminate the gun
trafficking routes
according to whistleblowers and
investigators however agents never made
an attempt to actually trace the guns on
December 14th 2010 a border patrol agent
has gunned down in Arizona near the
Mexico border this tragic event rewrote
the narrative of the investigation in a
remote stretch of Peck Canyon Arizona
Mexican bandits attacked an elite u.s.
Border Patrol unit and killed an agent
named Brian Terry the attackers fled
leaving behind two semi-automatic rifles
a trace of the guns serial numbers
revealed that the weapons had been
purchased 11 months earlier at a Phoenix
area gun store by a fast and furious
suspect soon after Terry's death ktf
agent speak with Senator Charles
Grassley Republican Iowa the ranking
minority member of the Senate Judiciary
Committee to seek his help in stopping
the operation CBS News airs its first
report on the alleged gun walking during
fast and furious quoting at least 11 ATF
agents and the senior managers who did
not wish to be named they say they
repeatedly warned superiors that the
gun-walking plan was dangerous and a
federal agent could end up getting shot
with one of the walked weapons one agent
told CBS News the numbers are over 2500
on that case the US attorney Dennis
Burke announces and diamonds along with
the first public details of the case
ending Operation Fast and Furious and in
late January 2011
grassi's hearings begin
in March 2011 ATF Special Agent John
Dodson blows the whistle on the gun
walking operation and it's linked to
Terry's death in an exclusive interview
with CBS News
Dawson defies officials who say it never
happened telling CBS News I'm here boots
on the ground and Phoenix telling you
we've been doing it every day since I've
been here we just knew it wasn't going
to end well there's just no way it could
this interview came after death of
immigration officer Jamie Isabella who
was killed and colleague Victor Avila
injured when they came under attack on a

February 2011 authorities discovered one
of the weapons used against them was
bought in Dallas Texas whistleblower
Peter for celli assigned to the ATF

Furious operation was centered told a
House committee in June 2011 that agency
supervisors have allowed weapons
including semi-automatic rifles to be
provided to individuals whom they knew
with traffic them to Mexican drug
cartels
in March President Obama tells Univision

new Louisville approved fast and furious
quote there may be a situation here
which a serious mistake was made
said President Obama and if that's the

unrelated topic representative darrell
issa republican california asked

not sure the exact date but I probably

answer is later called into question
based on memos directed to Holder nearly
a year earlier congressional hearings
into operation fast and furious begin in
in June 2011 the family of Brian Terry
appear at those hearings led by
representative barrel assembly they
suggest they've been given no answers in
the murder of Brian a Justice Department

Congress that his agency has complied
with and cooperated with at the house

us far Josefin tario was asked what she
would say to those responsible if a
walked gun was the one used to kill her
son I do not know what I would say to

months
numerous resignations occur most notably
the movement of Bureau of Alcohol
Tobacco Firearms and Explosives acting
director Kenneth Nelson he was moved out
of the top job at the bureau and sent to
DOJ to the office of legal programs also
the US Attorney for Arizona Dennis Burke
submitted his resignation to President
Obama after he appeared at was
by congressional investigators assistant
US attorney in Phoenix and Maury Hurley
who worked under Burke and helped
oversee the controversial case was
transferred out from the Criminal
Division and into the Civil Division ATF
Phoenix Special Agent in Charge bill
Newell was reassigned to headquarters
and to assistant special agent in charge
on her fast and furious George Diller
and Jim needles were also moved to other
positions the flurry of personnel shifts
came as the Inspector General continued
investigating the Operation Fast &
Furious scandal at the Justice
Department and the ATF documents
surfaced showing that Holder received
briefings on Fast and Furious as early
as July 2010 in May 2011 at a
congressional hearing he said he had
known specifically about the gun walking
tactics for only a few weeks CBS News
reported that these briefings were in
the form of Justice Department memos to
all over Michigan fast and furious as
early as July 2010 the memo seem to
contradict holders May testimony that he
had just recently learned of Operation
Fast and Furious other documents show of
senior Justice officials were familiar
with fast and furious Holder sends a
letter to Congress explaining that he
never saw the memos mentioning fast and
furious and that top Justice Department
officials who were briefed on the case
didn't know about the controversial
gun-walking tactics being used then
miraculously in November holder
testifies at the Senate Judiciary
hearing Lee admits to Congress for the
first time that gun-walking happened and
fast and furious he also tells senators
that his agency's initial letter to
Congress denying gun-walking last
February was inaccurate
documents reveal that some ATF agents
discussed using fast and furious to
provide anecdotal cases to support
controversial nervo neural emails
obtained by the CBS network show ATF
agents discussing how they can tie guns
involved in Mexican violence to gun
dealers based in the u.s. to justify the

you see if these guns were all purchased

gun multiple sales things the emails
show ATF members congratulating blaming

were the ones who living them straight
to Mexican criminals and the program
other emails document how gun dealers
involved in the program expressed

up in the hands of the bad guys only to

nothing to worry about one law

email suggested the ATF created the

point it's like ATF created or added to
the problem so they could be the
solution to it and pack themselves in
the bank it's a circular way of thinking
fast and furious erupted as a major
scandal for the Obama administration the
story had garnered huge interest on Fox
News and then became the subject of
numerous reports on media outlets from
CNN to the New York Times the scandal
has prompted repeated congressional
hearings with US Attorney General Eric
Holder testifying multiple times with
dueling reports from congressional
committees being written and ongoing
investigations by the Justice
Department's inspector general during
the investigations the DOJ refuses to
turn over internal communications
related to the February 4th letter which
denied gun-walking
call before the House Judiciary
Committee again in early 2012 holder
states that the Department of Justice is
not involved in a cover-up the House
Oversight Committee filed a civil
lawsuit against the Attorney General
Eric Holder in the fast and furious case
to put it simply the charges were that
holer ignored subpoenas and withheld
fast and furious documents from Congress
and thus was in contempt of Congress the
documents are the starting point to
actual prosecutions of criminal and
civil liability to this day they are yet
to be released this was the first time
that a US Attorney General had been held
in contempt of Congress the House voted
for both criminal and civil contempt of
Congress Obama's press secretary Jay
Carney announced that the White House
would not act to direct the DOJ to
prosecute holder criminally on the
intent of Congress charges with Obama
claiming executive privilege now we hear
of another cover-up by the ATF regarding
Operation Fast and Furious
according to reports it appears that
guns sold to the administration's
Mexican drug cartel partners ended up in

137 and wounded more than 300 in Paris
according to judicial watch one of the

operation a report of investigation ROI

ATF leaders went out of their way to

identity was kept quiet the villus day

queue dad who Erez at about midnight and

it has previously been discovered that

relentless assault came from fast and
